title: 'Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker' releases final trailer
text:
"Star Wars" fans had a big reason to tune in to "Monday Night Football" this week: the final trailer for "The Rise of Skywalker" debuted at halftime.

Interested in Star Wars? Add Star Wars as an interest to stay up to date on the latest Star Wars news, video, and analysis from ABC News. Add Interest

Fans who were moved by the new footage could act on that excitement immediately, as ticket sales have now begun.

"Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker" is the final installment of the nine-film Skywalker Saga, first set forth in George Lucas's "Star Wars," and is set to hit theaters Dec. 20.

"Taking one last look, sir, at my friends," C-3PO utters in a quiet moment in the trailer while staring at the assembled heroes.

The trailer finishes with one last utterance of "The force will be with you -- always," from Luke Skywalker.

Daisy Ridley is back as Rey, and fighting with Adam Driver's Kylo Ren, while John Boyega returns as Finn. The filmmakers have also said the late Carrie Fisher will return as Leia, using footage shot -- but not included -- from the previous film.

Much of the movie's plot has remained under wraps, even though Lucasfilm released teasers at Star Wars Celebration in April and at D23 in August. Lucasfilm President Kathleen Kennedy told "GMA" at Celebration that "The Rise of Skywalker," which is directed by J.J. Abrams, is the "epitome of good versus evil."

"There's a lot of conflict in this movie, but I think where it goes and the resolution is very hopeful," she added. "I think it will absolutely live up to the hype."

Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker Build My Droid Contest

Star Wars: Force for Change has teamed up with the global robotics community, FIRST, to give fans ages 16 and up the chance to design a droid for the Star Wars galaxy.

The winning designer will be invited to the world premiere of Star Wars: #TheRiseofSkywalker in December.

Contestants must submit their droid design in the form of a sketch, drawing, or painting at starwars.com/buildmydroidcontest by November 13, 2019.

NO PURCH NEC. 16+ in 50 US & DC, Canada (ex Quebec), Mexico, GB, Spain, France, Belgium, Japan. Ends 23:59:59 Pacific Standard Time Nov 13 2019 (08:59:59 Paris Time Nov 14). Prize requires travel to US in Dec 2019. Max 1 entry per person. Rules/T&Cs: www.starwars.com/BuildMyDroidContest. Void in Quebec & where prohibited. Sponsor: ABC, Inc. d/b/a Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures, USA.

Submit your droid design at https://starwars.com/buildmydroidcontest

ABC News and Lucasfilm are both part of parent company Disney.
